doc:
Lurene Tuttle https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lurene_Tuttle 0 Lurene Tuttle (August 29, 1907 – May 28, 1986) was an American character actress and acting coach, who made the transition from vaudeville to radio, and later films and television. Her most enduring impact was as one of network radio's more versatile actresses. Often appearing in 15 shows per week, comedies, dramas, thrillers, soap operas, and crime dramas, she became known as the "First Lady of Radio". Lurene_Tuttle ( August_29_,_1907 – May_28_,_1986 ) was an_American_character_actress and acting coach , who made the_transition from vaudeville to radio , and later films_and_television . Her_most_enduring_impact was as one of network_radio 's_more_versatile_actresses . Often appearing in 15_shows per week , comedies , dramas , thrillers , soap_operas , and crime_dramas , she became_known as the_"_First_Lady of Radio_" .
